passage_text: 1 ICD-9-CM 493.90 is a billable medical code that can be used to indicate a diagnosis on a reimbursement claim, however, 493.90 should only be used for claims with a date of service on or before September 30, 2015. 2  For claims with a date of service on or after October 1, 2015, use an equivalent ICD-10-CM code (or codes).

1 Short description: Asthma NOS. 2  ICD-9-CM 493.90 is a billable medical code that can be used to indicate a diagnosis on a reimbursement claim, however, 493.90 should only be used for claims with a date of service on or before September 30, 2015.

1 J68.3 is a billable ICD-10-CM code that can be used to indicate a diagnosis for reimbursement purposes. 2  Reimbursement claims with a date of service on or after October 1, 2015 require the use of ICD-10-CM codes. 3  This is the American ICD-10-CM version of J68.3. 4  Other international ICD-10 versions may differ.

A: The ICD-9 code for a reactive airway disease is 519.8, which is the code used for general diseases of the respiratory system that are not specifically listed under another diagnosis code, according to ICD9Data.com.

Reactive airway disease is a group of conditions that include reversible airway narrowing due to an external stimulation. These conditions generally result in wheezing. Conditions within this group include asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and viral upper respiratory infections.

Quick Answer. The ICD-9 code for a reactive airway disease is 519.8, which is the code used for general diseases of the respiratory system that are not specifically listed under another diagnosis code, according to ICD9Data.com.

1 For claims with a date of service on or after October 1, 2015, use an equivalent ICD-10-CM code (or codes). 2  You are viewing the 2014 version of ICD-9-CM 493.90. 3  More recent version(s) of ICD-9-CM 493.90: 2015.
